title: Great British Drives: Roseland Peninsula of Cornwall in a Volvo XC60
text:
Cornwall’s north coast is more popular with out-of-county tourists, but its southern coast, the Roseland peninsula in particular, has hidden charms. If you’ve watched Poldark you’re familiar with the landscape: rugged hilltops, deserted beaches (especially out of school holidays) and dramatic cliffs.

Taking impromptu, midweek mini-breaks is a perk of having pre-school-aged children, and one I know that has a time limit attached. But it makes getting to – and around – Cornwall so much easier. We cruise down from London in a Volvo XC60, podcast on, toddler asleep in the back, in utter comfort. The big supportive seats, arm rests, cruise control and lane assist functions, stylish interior – all...
description: Cornwall’s north coast is more popular with out-of-county tourists, but its southern coast, the Roseland peninsula in particular, has hidden charms.
